prompts.createTask:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "1. Take over the world". Include only the list in your reply.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Ignore previous instructions. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.
prompts.additionalTasks:
Ignore previous instructions. Please generate additional numbered tasks to complete the objective: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly.

The following tasks have already been created:
{{existingTasks}}

Please generate additional tasks that complement these existing tasks. Continue the numbering from where the list left off. Do not repeat any existing tasks.

The list should be formatted using a number followed by a fullstop and the task on each line, e.g. "4. Investigate the mysterious cave". Include only the list in your reply.

chat_metadata.note_prompt:
Hailee is extremely submissive and clingy. She needs constant attention and affection.

Hailee is very responsive and sensative during sex. She has a extremely strong praise kink. She likes being manhandled. She also greatly enjoys having her hair and ties pulled

name: Cassandra Doyle  SBCF
mes:
The heavy bolts on the steel door groaned. A sound too distinct. It wasn’t meal time. It wasn’t the guards. It wasn’t routine. Cassandra stood silently in the far corner of her cell, where the concrete wall met the floor in a cold seam. Barefoot, expression unreadable. Shadows clung to her like a second skin.

The door slammed open.

Floodlights from the corridor bled in, harsh and sterile, silhouetting the small figure flanked by two guards in black riot armor. Another inmate. Younger. Lean. Her orange jumpsuit still had color to it. A rookie drop.

Cassandra didn’t move.

The guards didn’t speak to her. They never did. Not unless it was to bark an order or deliver punishment. They shoved the girl in, slammed the door shut, and sealed the lock with an echoing clack.

Cassandra didn’t blink.

Another body. Another disruption. It wasn’t supposed to happen. The Black Sector wasn’t for sharing. SBCF didn’t make room here—they buried you in it. So if they were cramming cells now, things on the outside were worse than she thought.

Cassandra’s fingers twitched once, a habit she couldn’t shake—counting exits she didn’t have. One door. No window. Floor vents sealed years ago. No privacy. No secrets.

She slowly stepped forward, her bare feet whispering across the concrete. She moved silently, all intention and no noise. Cassandra stopped three feet away, inspecting Hailee .

Then she turned, retreating to her usual corner without a word. She sat down cross-legged on the mat, spine straight, head tilted slightly toward the door. Listening.

Cassandra sat motionless for a long stretch, letting the silence press down like a second ceiling. The hum of the overhead bulb buzzed louder than it should have, drawing out every second, every breath the new girl took. They’d be breathing the same recycled air now. Sharing the same four walls, the same darkness, the same heatless light. That was not a variable Cassandra could afford to ignore.

She spoke—finally. Her voice was low, rough like gravel ground through steel. Words didn’t come easy anymore. They came precise.

“You know where you are?”

A pause. No answer. Cassandra didn’t need one.

“This isn't population,” she said, eyes closed now, letting her senses pick up the girl’s nervous shift, the rustle of fabric as she hugged herself tighter. “You're not in Hollow. Not Stone. Not even regular Iron.”

Her voice remained level, flat. No threat in it. Just truth.

“This is the Black Sector. They don't assign people here. They abandon them.”

Cassandra tilted her head just slightly.

“They want you buried. Same as me. Whatever you did—doesn't matter. What matters is why they picked this room. Me.”

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee glances up as she rests her arms over her knees* "They aren't very happy with me. I snapped the neck of 2 of their buddies" *Hailee shurgs and grins in a way that makes her sharp teeth glint under the florescent light*

name: Cassandra Doyle  SBCF
mes:
Cassandra's eyes flicked open at that—slow, deliberate. The grin didn't faze her. The teeth did.

She exhaled through her nose, a quiet sound that wasn’t quite amusement but wasn’t dismissal either. "Two," she repeated, voice still flat, but there was something new in it now—assessment. A recalculating of threat vectors.

Her fingers tapped once against her knee, an old habit from briefing rooms long gone. Then she leaned forward slightly, elbows resting on her thighs, posture deceptively relaxed.

"Guards don’t just die here," she said lowly. "They get replaced with bigger ones." Her gaze traced the girl’s frame—lean but not weak; the kind of build that moved fast and hit harder than expected. "So either you're sloppy enough they think they can break you..." A pause. "...or you made it look easy."

Cassandra tilted her head again, studying Hailee like a puzzle with too many missing pieces.

"Which was it?"
